original_title: Australian govt. to give AUD42.1mn for good governance, MDF programs
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The government will extend a market development facility program (MDF) implemented under the Australian government’s grant-in-aid program.
An agreement was reached in 2017 between the Australian and Sri Lankan governments to implement the good governance for growth program and the market development facility program.
The cabinet, this week, approved to enter into adjunct arrangements with the Australian government for the further implementation of these two projects by obtaining the grants.
“The Australian government has agreed to provide an additional grant of 42.1 million Australian dollars for those programs,” a statement by the Department of Government Information said.

MDF is a multi-country effort, financed by the Australian Government, that aims to increase worker’s earnings in partner nations Sri Lanka, Papua New Guinea, Fiji, Timor-Leste, and the Pacific Region, to foster sustainable economic growth.

According to Country Director of MDF Maryam Piracha, “Australia’s Market Development Facility looks at sectors that have growth opportunities and potential to improve sector performance, improve business growth and improve the opportunities for farmers to get more employment opportunities.”

Using a Market Systems Development (MSD) methodology, MDF links people, companies, governments, and non-governmental organisations with both domestic and international markets. These efforts are meant to streamline investment, partnerships and coordination, enabling inclusive growth.

MDF concentrates on developing the fishing, agriculture, and tourist industries of Sri Lanka. Important areas of assistance include the promotion of high-end, environmentally friendly travel, premium agricultural goods and services, agricultural technology, and export-oriented fisheries.

Funded by the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs (DFAT), MDF links people, companies, governments, and non-governmental organisations with domestic and international markets. (Colombo/Dec20/2023)
